data.title: nth unique word
data.statement:
Given a number [[n]] and a [[sentence]] made of several words, you must ouput the [[n]]th <<unique>> word from that [[sentence]].
A word is considered <<unique>> only the first time it appears in the [[sentence]]. The same word which appears later in the sentence is not considered unique.
Words may contain uppercase letters, which must be considered the same way as lowercase letters, and may contain commas or dots, which must be ignored.

If a word is a contraction (like "don't", "isn't", or "you'd"), it must be considered as a single word.

testCases.title: Test 2
testCases.testIn:
4
Once upon a time in England, there was a farm.

testCases.title: Validator 2
testCases.testIn:
6
Once upon a time in America, there was a saloon.

testCases.title: Test 3
testCases.testIn:
8
When you are right, no one remembers. When you are wrong, no one forgets.

testCases.title: Validator 3
testCases.testIn:
9
When you are right, no one remembers. When you are wrong, no one forgives.

testCases.title: Test 4
testCases.testIn:
8
Everybody wants to go to heaven, but nobody wants to die.

testCases.title: Validator 4
testCases.testIn:
5
Everybody wants to go to heaven, but nobody wants to die.

testCases.title: Test 5
testCases.testIn:
15
It is true that we do not know what we have got until we lose it, but it is also true that we do not know what we have been missing until it arrives.

testCases.title: Validator 5
testCases.testIn:
18
It is true that we do not know what we have got until we lose it, but it is also true that we do not know what we have been missing until it arrives.

testCases.title: Test 6
testCases.testIn:
15
The only way to keep your health is to eat what you do not want, drink what you do not like, and do what you would rather not.

testCases.title: Validator 6
testCases.testIn:
16
The only way to keep your health is to eat what you do not want, drink what you do not like, and do what you would rather not.

data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
read sentence:string(5500)
write word

INPUT
n: a number
l: a string containing a sentence
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> an integer [[n]].
<<Line 2:>> a [[sentence]] made of several words, separated by spaces and/or punctuation (dots or commas).
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> the [[n]]th unique word from [[sentence]], without punctuation, and lowercased.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given a number n and a sentence made of several words, you must ouput the nth unique word from that sentence.
A word is considered unique only the first time it appears in the sentence. The same word which appears later in the sentence is not considered unique.
Words may contain uppercase letters, which must be considered the same way as lowercase letters, and may contain commas or dots, which must be ignored.

If a word is a contraction (like "don't", "isn't", or "you'd"), it must be considered as a single word.
Input
Line 1: an integer n.
Line 2: a sentence made of several words, separated by spaces and/or punctuation (dots or commas).
Output
Line 1: the nth unique word from sentence, without punctuation, and lowercased.
Constraints
1 ≤ n ≤ number of unqiue words in sentence
Example
Input
3
Wake, Work, Eat, Sleep, Repeat.
Output
eat
